summary: "The Creation of Adam" is a famous painting by Michelangelo, found on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel. It shows God giving life to Adam, the first man, from the Bible's Book of Genesis. Painted around 1508-1512, it's the fourth in a series of panels telling stories from Genesis. This iconic image has been copied and parodied many times, making it one of the most well-known religious paintings ever.
title: The Creation of Adam
